How We Work

Listen ‚Üí Curiosity ‚Üí Action ‚Üí Art

Our methodology is rooted in First Nations principles of deep listening, community sovereignty, and regenerative innovation. We don't impose solutions‚Äîwe amplify existing community wisdom.

The LCAA Framework

Every engagement follows our Listen ‚Üí Curiosity ‚Üí Action ‚Üí Art methodology, ensuring community voices lead from the very beginning.

‚óë

1. Listen

Sit in silence to take in knowledge.

We start every engagement by deeply listening to community voices, understanding existing knowledge systems, and respecting cultural protocols. No assumptions, no predetermined solutions.

  • Community mapping sessions
  • Elder consultations
  • Cultural protocol training
  • Asset-based community assessment
ü§î

2. Curiosity

Ask better questions together.

Working with communities to frame challenges as opportunities, identifying leverage points, and exploring what's already working that can be amplified.

  • Appreciative inquiry workshops
  • Systems mapping
  • Design thinking sessions
  • Traditional knowledge integration
üõ†Ô∏è

3. Action

Build with, not for.

Co-creating tools, platforms, and systems that communities own and control. Everything designed for obsolescence‚Äîsuccess means being no longer needed.

  • Community-owned platforms
  • Capacity building programs
  • Open-source tool development
  • Local leadership development
üé®

4. Art

Make it beautiful and joyful.

Ensuring solutions are not just functional but bring joy, dignity, and cultural beauty. Change should feel good and honor community aesthetics.

  • Community-led design
  • Cultural storytelling
  • Celebration rituals
  • Joy impact assessments

Guiding Principles

These principles guide every decision we make and every partnership we enter into.

‚óÜ Design for Obsolescence

Every tool we build comes with sunset clauses and "forkable" intellectual property. Success means communities no longer need us‚Äîthey own and control their own tools and platforms.

üåâ Bridge, Not Savior

We're not here to save anyone. We're infrastructure‚Äîconnecting resources, knowledge, and opportunities while ensuring communities maintain sovereignty over their own development.

ü§≤ Community Ownership

Every platform, tool, and system we develop is owned and governed by the communities it serves. IP is shared, data is controlled locally, and governance is community-led.

üòä Joy Assessments

We measure impact through both quantitative data and qualitative "joy"‚Äîdignity, agency, cultural pride, and community wellbeing. Numbers tell part of the story.

üîÑ Regenerative Innovation

All solutions must regenerate social, cultural, environmental, and economic systems. We're not just solving problems‚Äîwe're building community resilience.

‚ö° Power Transfer

Like a tractor's PTO, we transfer capacity to community-led initiatives. We provide plug-and-play capacity-building, then step back as local capacity grows.

How We Measure Success

Traditional metrics miss the full picture. Our impact framework includes both quantitative outcomes and qualitative joy indicators.

üìä Quantitative Metrics

  • Community ownership percentage
  • Local capacity building hours
  • Revenue staying in community
  • Environmental regeneration indicators
  • Cultural knowledge preservation

üòä Joy Indicators

  • Community agency and self-determination
  • Cultural pride and celebration
  • Intergenerational knowledge sharing
  • Dignity and respect in processes
  • Collective efficacy and hope
